messages.message: There is nothing to refresh: the credentials work in an entirely different way now.
Hmm bit stumped by this. Not sure anyone else has seen this intermittent behavior
Might want to back up your code and wipe your sandbox (including $HOME)

> if I restart a service (in my case `core-platform`) it can throw another aws creds error
just to sanity check
• how are you restarting `core-platform`?
• how are you inspecting the logs from `core-platform` after restarting it?

This issue likely stems from the same problem as this: when you modify the code in CPS, it caused this issue.


https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1753478281517409?thread_ts=1753473785.710409&cid=C05L87V014J
@Serena I do `cs restart core-platform` to restart it, and I look at the logs using this view logs button

@mfichman So should I do this:
1. Push local changes to remote branch and save `.bashrc` (added some aliases)
2. `rm -rf $HOME`
3. Suspend & Resume
4. clone `instabase` repo if it doesn't exist already

Did you modify anything in CPS?

Maybe try to discard local change, then git pull, then resync.

or to bypass the error temporarily.


https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1753480743288989?thread_ts=1753473785.710409&cid=C05L87V014J
But this was before we added the second ecr registry right?
I have the second ECR registry thing, but I still get the 401 error when I modify something in CPS.
Okay, will give that a shot next time I restart cps then, ty
@Sayan Didn’t encounter the issue anymore. Do you know how to fix it?

hmm I haven't needed to restart CPS recently but this fixed model-service for me: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1753742455573069?thread_ts=1753388110.844289&cid=C05L87V014J

I needed to resync and restart the workspace
@prateek.tenkale I can take a look in 1 hour (meetings)
Thanks @mfichman , after I suspended & restarted I'm unblocked, but we can still schedule time if you are curious to take a look. Otherwise no worries it's not urgent
